page.title: 09Education
page.content: The area contained a variety of educational establishments serving not only the local children but alos those from abroad. There are nursery schools, primary and secondary schools as well as the American International University. Two of the secondary schools occupy buildings put up during the 19th Century, Grange Park Comprehensive School for Boys is in the former Junior Masonic School for Boys and part of Queen's Comprehensive school uses the Royal Caledonian Schools buildings. The primary schools have been built mainly since World War 2 to serve the post war housing developments associated with the new Trading Estates. They all have extensive grounds and facilities. Because of falling school rolls Grange Park school is due to close at the end of the summer term 1985.
